segment.source: How to Pack a MED-V Image
segment.target: How to Pack a MED-V Image

segment.source: How to Pack a MED-V Image
segment.target: How to Pack a MED-V Image

segment.source: How to Pack a MED-V Image
segment.target: How to Pack a MED-V Image

segment.source: A MED-V image must be packed before it can be added to a deployment package or uploaded to the server.
segment.target: A MED-V image must be packed before it can be added to a deployment package or uploaded to the server.

segment.source: To create a packed MED-V image
segment.target: To create a packed MED-V image

segment.source: Click the Images management button.
segment.target: Click the Images management button.

segment.source: In the Images module, in the Local Packed Images pane, click New.
segment.target: In the Images module, in the Local Packed Images pane, click New.

segment.source: In the Packed Image Creation dialog box, select the virtual machine image by doing one of the following:
segment.target: In the Packed Image Creation dialog box, select the virtual machine image by doing one of the following:

segment.source: In the Base image file field, type the full path to the directory where the Microsoft Virtual PC image prepared for MED-V is located.
segment.target: In the Base image file field, type the full path to the directory where the Microsoft Virtual PC image prepared for MED-V is located.

segment.source: Click Browse to browse to the directory where the Microsoft Virtual PC image prepared for MED-V is located.
segment.target: Click Browse to browse to the directory where the Microsoft Virtual PC image prepared for MED-V is located.

segment.source: Specify the name of the new image by doing one of the following:
segment.target: Specify the name of the new image by doing one of the following:

segment.source: In the Image name field, type the desired name.
segment.target: In the Image name field, type the desired name.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The following characters cannot be included in the image name: space " / : ?
segment.target: The following characters cannot be included in the image name: space " / : ?

segment.source: A new packed image will be created.
segment.target: A new packed image will be created.

segment.source: From the drop-down list, select an existing name.
segment.target: From the drop-down list, select an existing name.

segment.source: A new version of the existing image will be created.
segment.target: A new version of the existing image will be created.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: A new MED-V packed image is created on your host computer with the properties defined in the following table.
segment.target: A new MED-V packed image is created on your host computer with the properties defined in the following table.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: In the Local Packed Images and Packed Images on Server panes, the most recent version of each image is displayed as the parent node.
segment.target: In the Local Packed Images and Packed Images on Server panes, the most recent version of each image is displayed as the parent node.

segment.source: Click the parent node to view all other existing versions of the image.
segment.target: Click the parent node to view all other existing versions of the image.

segment.source: Local Packed Images Properties
segment.target: Local Packed Images Properties

segment.source: Property
segment.target: Property

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Image Name
segment.target: Image Name

segment.source: The name of the packed image as it was defined when the administrator created the image.
segment.target: The name of the packed image as it was defined when the administrator created the image.

segment.source: Version
segment.target: Version

segment.source: The version of the displayed image.
segment.target: The version of the displayed image.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: All previous versions are kept unless deleted.
segment.target: All previous versions are kept unless deleted.

segment.source: File Size (compressed)
segment.target: File Size (compressed)

segment.source: The physical compressed size of the image.
segment.target: The physical compressed size of the image.

segment.source: Image Size (uncompressed)
segment.target: Image Size (uncompressed)

segment.source: The physical uncompressed size of the image.
segment.target: The physical uncompressed size of the image.
